poem:
A Visit to Rome

Starmer's tie flapped in the gentle Roman breeze,
beyond politics, there's the sound of fountains
and Vespas cutting through ancient streets.
Lampedusa whispers in the margins, dinghies,
the salt-heavy air hushes ambition, and still,
he probes for answers under Piazza sky—
a world laced with questions, not just policies.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How has Italy sought to cut irregular migration and could UK copy the policy? Keir Starmer has travelled to Rome for bilateral talks about immigration with Italy’s prime minister, Giorgia Meloni. The British prime minister, under pressure to tackle irregular migration across the Channel from France, wants to examine how Meloni’s hard-right government has cut the number of people arriving in dinghies across the Mediterranean. What policies has the Meloni government pursued? Last September, Lampedusa". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: How has Italy sought to cut irregular migration and could UK copy the policy? What policies has the Meloni government pursued? Last September, Lampedusa
